events.message: Customer reported a vehicle accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th, involving a collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description mentioning a car collision and resulting damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer’s vehicle accident claim to ensure timely processing and assistance.
The customer was contacted to acknowledge receipt of their vehicle collision claim and to inform them about the next steps.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license for further investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including clear photos of the car damage and official police report from the accident.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted documents and assessing the details of the vehicle collision accident.
Investigation concluded confirming liability and extent of damages sustained to the customer’s vehicle in the accident.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on damages and claim policy limits for the auto accident.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and the responsiveness of the claims process.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance provider following receipt of customer acceptance of the settlement.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was processed and issued to the customer’s designated bank account.
The claim was successfully closed following completion of payment and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
All documentation and records related to the vehicle accident claim were archived securely for future reference.
